definition: preliminary round of imperial examinations/abbr. for 科學考察|科学考察[ke1 xue2 kao3 cha2], scientific exploration
branch of study/administrative section/division/field/branch/stage directions/family (taxonomy)/rules/laws/to mete out (punishment)/to levy (taxes etc)/to fine sb/CL:個|个[ge4]
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father
scientific exploration team/expedition

sentences.english: The scientific investigation team found many mammoth fossils in the forest.
sentences.chinese: 科考人員在森林中發現了很多毛象的屍骨化石。

sentences.english: The researchers of science broke out a sled from the ice.
sentences.chinese: 科考人員從冰中取出一個雪撬。

sentences.english: What Are the SAT Subject Tests?
That's why doing fieldwork on Arctic sea ice is so important.
sentences.chinese: 這就是爲什麼對北極海冰進行實地科考很重要。

sentences.english: This station is comprised of three buildings with slightly different dimensions.
sentences.chinese: 該科考站由三座尺寸略有差異的單體建築組合而成。

sentences.english: The scientific investigation team devote themselves to seeking for traces of primitive man.
sentences.chinese: 科考隊一直致力於找尋原始人類的遺蹤。

definition: imperial examination
the triennial provincial imperial exam during the Ming and Qing
imperial examinations (in former times)
court examination, the top grade imperial exam
to pass an exam
metropolitan civil service examination (held triennially in spring in imperial times)/Crown Prince's chambers/by extension, the Crown Prince
successful candidate in the highest imperial civil service examination/palace graduate
metropolitan examination (imperial civil service examination)
autumn exam (triennial provincial exam during Ming and Qing)
graduate/successful candidate in the imperial provincial examination
the last of the three entry-level exams in the imperial examination system of Ming and Qing dynasties
scholarly honor (in imperial exams)/rank/achievement/fame/glory
prefectural exam, the 2nd of the three entry-level exams in the imperial examination system of Ming and Qing dynasties
title of the temporary position in the Hanlin Academy, conferred to meritorious candidates until the next examination
to take an exam
successful military candidate in the imperial provincial examination
